content.raw:
I checked the ROS head frame to Gazebo world frame transform and it depends on how the robot lands when the harness is detached, but generally is around these values:

```
#!python

head frame XYZ: 0, 0, 0 becomes world frame XYZ: 0.136740, -0.047332, 1.617657
```
and that -0.47 Y offset is around half of the offset difference I am seeing in the answers.  Can you check the world -> head frame?
